metadata.title: CVE-2016-5705 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.4.xbefore 4.4.15.7 and 4.6.x before 4.6.3 allow remote attackers to injectarbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving (1) server-privilegescertificate data fields on the user privileges page, (2) an "invalid JSON"error message in the error console, (3) a database name in the centralcolumns implementation, (4) a group name, or (5) a search name in thebookmarks implementation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.3-1').
